body_text.text: It is often challenging to differentiate tuberculous pleural effusion (TPE) from malignant pleural effusion (MPE).
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: In this regard, cytological examination of pleural effusion (PE) is a simple and common method.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: The technique has 100% specificity, but its sensitivity is between 43% and 83%; this is far from satisfactory.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: [1][2][3] In cases of negative cytological PE, diagnosis is based on invasive procedures such as thoracoscopy.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: Although this method has 90% sensitivity, [4] it may be too invasive for patients in poor physical condition.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: By way of a solution to these problems, measuring the concentration of various tumor markers (TMs) in PE is a useful and noninvasive procedure for distinguishing between benign PE and MPE.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: [5][6][7] The TMs concerned are carbohydrate antigen 125 (CA125), carbohydrate antigen 153, carbohydrate antigen 199 (CA199), carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA), cytokeratin 19 fragment, neuron-specific enolase (NSE), and squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) associated antigen.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: However, their cut-off values and sensitivities in identifying MPE are not well understood.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: This retrospective study aimed to assess the diagnostic capability of each of the following TMs: CA125, CA199, CEA, NSE, and SCC.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: Their levels were measured in both serum and the pleural fluid to differentiate between TPE and MPE.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: Furthermore, the ratio of pleural fluid concentration to serum concentration (P/S ratio) for each TM was also assessed.
body_text.section: IntroductIon

body_text.text: We enrolled 130 consecutive patients who had been treated at the Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine of the Beijing Chao-Yang Hospital between January 2013 and December 2013.
body_text.section: Patients and classification of pleural effusion

body_text.text: A diagnosis of MPE (n = 95) or TPE (n = 35) was made based on thoracoscopy.
body_text.section: Patients and classification of pleural effusion

body_text.text: The origin and histological types of MPE were lung adenocarcinoma (n = 62), lung SCC (n = 5), small cell lung carcinoma (n = 9), pleural mesothelioma (n = 12), breast cancer (n = 3), ovarian cancer (n = 1), hepatic cancer (n = 1), lymphoma (n = 1), and leukemia (n = 1).
body_text.section: Patients and classification of pleural effusion

body_text.text: The following clinical and radiological characteristics were considered [ Tables 1 and 2]: (1) PE size (three categories: <1/3 of the hemithorax; ≥1/3, but ≤2/3 of the hemithorax; >2/3 of the hemithorax), [6] and (2) simple X-ray or computed tomography images suggestive of malignancy (lung masses, pulmonary atelectasis, lung nodules, infiltrated shadow, cavity, pleural nodules, and pleural thickening).
body_text.section: Clinical radiological characteristics

body_text.text: Pleural fluid and blood were collected before any treatment.
body_text.section: Tumor markers assay

body_text.text: Both serum and pleural fluid were centrifuged at 3000 r/min for 15 min.
body_text.section: Tumor markers assay

body_text.text: TM assays were performed using electrochemiluminescence kits (Abbott Laboratories i2000™; Abbott Park, USA for CA125, CA199, CEA, and SCC; Cobas 6000™; Roche, Mannheim, Germany for NSE).
body_text.section: Tumor markers assay

body_text.text: SPSS statistical software 17.0 (IBM, USA) was used for data processing.
body_text.section: Statistical analysis

body_text.text: The data were mostly expressed as the median and interquartile range (IQR).
body_text.section: Statistical analysis

body_text.text: Concentration differences between the TPE and MPE groups were evaluated for statistical significance using the nonparametric MannWhitney U-test.
body_text.section: Statistical analysis

body_text.text: The optimal sensitivity and specificity points were selected as the critical values using the area under the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve; in this way, we calculated, for each of the TMs, the sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, and negative predictive value for diagnosing TPE and MPE.
body_text.section: Statistical analysis

body_text.text: In addition, we evaluated the ability of a combination of all five TMs to distinguish between TPE and MPE.
body_text.section: Statistical analysis

body_text.text: Three prognostic models were constructed: Model 1 involved the serum level of TMs, Model 2 the pleural fluid level, and Model 3 the P/S ratio.
body_text.section: Statistical analysis

body_text.text: P < 0.05 were considered statistically significant.
